title: Change of Condition — Suspected Stroke/TIA Protocol (LTC/SNF)
summary: A survey-ready triage workflow for suspected stroke/TIA: rapid symptom check, last-known-well, red flags, immediate escalation, and documentation elements.

sections.heading: Recognize stroke warning signs (FAST / BE-FAST)
sections.body: Assume stroke until proven otherwise when there is a sudden neurological change. Use FAST: Face drooping, Arm weakness, Speech difficulty, Time to call 911. Also consider sudden trouble seeing, loss of balance/coordination, or severe headache.

sections.heading: Time matters
sections.body: If stroke is suspected, treat as an emergency. Call 911 per facility emergency protocol and notify provider. Document last known well time, symptom onset (or when found), and baseline deficits.

sections.heading: First actions (do not delay)
sections.body: 1) Ensure safety and assess ABCs. 2) Obtain vitals and blood glucose (hypoglycemia can mimic stroke). 3) Assess neuro status (speech, facial symmetry, arm drift, pupils if trained). 4) Determine last-known-well time and anticoagulant use if known. 5) Call 911/activate emergency response per protocol and notify provider.

sections.heading: Documentation elements (survey-ready)
sections.body: Document: symptoms observed and exact time; last-known-well; vitals and glucose; focused neuro findings; notifications (EMS/provider/representative) with times; interventions; resident response and disposition.
